info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 6 at 4:27AM AKST until November 7 at 6:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage AK
info.description:
* WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations 4 to 8 inches. Winds gusting as high as 25 mph.
* WHERE...NW Kenai Peninsula and Skilak Lake.
* WHEN...From 3 PM this afternoon to 6 AM AKST Friday.
* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday evening and Friday morning commutes.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow will develop from east to west across the western Kenai Peninsula through Thursday afternoon and evening. The heaviest snow is expected late Thursday evening through early Friday morning before tapering off. Northerly winds will also increase Thursday night into Friday which may result in localized areas of blowing and drifting snow, especially along the immediate coast and Sterling Highway.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.

parameter.value: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 6 AM AKST FRIDAY
